intro: Filipendula lobata var. albiflora, commonly known as white flowering cinquefoil, is a perennial herb native to North America. It features compound leaves with five leaflets, often with a slightly serrated edge. The plant produces clusters of white, fluffy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking native plants.
